alert.note: Alert for Sabine; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 2:27PM CST until January 26 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting Sabine and San Augustine Counties. For the Ayish Bayou...including San Augustine...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ayish Bayou near San Augustine. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Minor lowland flooding of boat ramps. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 PM CST Wednesday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 13.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 04/18/1959. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 230 PM CST.
